roleset.name: enter, go in

example.name: enter-v: place entered as NP
example.text: An ambitious expansion has left Magna with excess capacity and a heavy debt load as the automotive industry enters a downturn.

example.name: enter-v: place entered as a PP
example.text: The two concerns said they entered into a definitive merger agreement under which Ratners will begin a tender offer for all of Weisfield's common shares for $57.50 each.
example.arg: into a definitive merger agreement under which Ratners will begin a tender offer for all of Weisfield's common shares for $57.50 each.

example.name: entry-n: autogen1
example.text: Intel 's entry in the crowded market for reduced instruction setcomputing , or RISC , computers
example.arg: in the crowded market for reduced instruction setcomputing , or RISC , computers

example.name: entry-n: autogen2
example.text: his entry into their official association

example.name: entry-n: With MNR
example.text: Visa - free entry to Macau for Taiwanese

example.name: entry-n: another
example.text: Taiwan 's early entry into biochip research and development

example.name: entering-n: Orpheus. Both args.
example.text: The gods would not consent to his entering the world of the dead a second time, while he was still alive

example.name: entrance-n: both args
example.text: the company 's entrance into the public facsimile business

example.name: entrance-n: arg 1 only
example.text: an avenue of entrance to a certain sector of society
example.arg: of entrance to a certain sector of society

example.name: entrance-n: One more with both args
example.text: A U.S citizen's entrance into Canada

example.name: entrance-n: NOT EVENTIVE! DO NOT ANNOTATE! Mark as .YY.
example.text: In the past the kings of Judah had put some horses and a chariot near the entrance to the Lord 's Temple .

roleset.note: ENTER-V NOTES: Verbnet class escape-51.1, other framed members are 'leave'. Also comparison with 'go in'. (from enter.01-v)
ENTERING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, enter.01. Corresponds to VNcls escape-51.1-2.. (from entering.01-n)
ENTRANCE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-9998. Comparison to enter.01-v. See VN class escape-51.1. FN class arriving. Framed by Katie. (from entrance.01-n)

roleset.name: submit something

example.name: enter-v: submit, transitive
example.text: On Oct. 19, 1987, [some investors]-1 learned the consequences of *trace*-1 entering ``good-til-canceled limit orders'' and then forgetting about them.

example.name: enter-v: including manner
example.text: [A limit order to sell]-1 could be entered *trace*-1 at that price .

example.name: enter-v: with benefactive
example.text: And even when a specific order is acceptable to an exchange, [a brokerage firm]-1 can refuse *trace*-1 to enter it for a customer.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: They also invited some experts to implement an appraisal of the industrial projects put forward by related countries , and then after the appraisal , entered these projects into the Industrial Development Organization 's network to attract international business .
example.arg: into the Industrial Development Organization 's network

example.name: enter-v: autogen1
example.text: the company 's order entry

example.name: entry-n: autogen2
example.text: accounting entries on the parent company 's books

example.name: entry-n: with args 0 & 1
example.text: his entry of plea

example.name: entry-n: Ooh! I found one with arg3!!!
example.text: his entry of political lawsuits on behalf of victims of human rights abuses
example.arg: on behalf of victims of human rights abuses

roleset.note: ENTER-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. No Vncls. (from enter.02-v)

roleset.name: put into a trance-like state

example.name: entrance-v: passive/adjectival
example.text: And, if still conscious at the evening's end, you notice something else: The audience, at first entranced and hypnotized by themusic, releases its pent-up feelings in collective gratitude.

example.name: entrance-v: all args
example.text: John entranced Mary with his soulful rendition of "I'm a Little Teapot."
example.arg: with his soulful rendition of "I'm a Little Teapot."

roleset.note: ENTRANCE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'entrance' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1. (from entrance.01-v)
